block.p: Catherine Maxwell O'Hara and Jonathan Scott Edwards were married yesterday by the Rev. Roger L. Prokop, a Roman Catholic priest, at Our Lady of the Snows Church in Woodstock, Vt.
Mrs. Edwards, 37, is a fund-raising director at Amherst College in Amherst, Mass., from which she graduated. She received an M.B.A. from Insead, the business school in Fontainebleau, France.

Catherine O'Hara, Jonathan Edwards Catherine Maxwell O'Hara and Jonathan Scott Edwards were married yesterday by the Rev. Roger L. Prokop, a Roman Catholic priest, at Our Lady of the Snows Church in Woodstock, Vt.
Catherine Maxwell O'Hara and Jonathan Scott Edwards were married yesterday by the Rev. Roger L. Prokop, a Roman Catholic priest, at Our Lady of the Snows Church in Woodstock, Vt.
Mrs. Edwards, 37, is a fund-raising director at Amherst College in Amherst, Mass., from which she graduated. She received an M.B.A. from Insead, the business school in Fontainebleau, France.

She is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. F. Peter O'Hara of Rye, N.Y. Her father, who retired as a senior partner in Cullen & Dykman, a Brooklyn law firm, is a deputy town attorney for Greenburgh, N.Y. Her mother, Robbie O'Hara, was a founder and president of the New York State chapter of the Alexander Graham Bell Association for the Deaf and Hard of Hearing.

Mr. Edwards, 40, is the director of external affairs at SmartPower, a Hartford marketing organization, which promotes renewable energy use in the Northeast. He graduated from Skidmore College, and received a master's degree in public administration from the University of Massachusetts at Amherst.

He is a stepson of Suzanne De Pree of Whately, Mass., and a son of the late Raymond Edwards and of the late Constance Kambour Edwards. His stepmother retired as a family psychologist in Whately. His father was a superintendent of public schools in Hanover, N.H.
